edu.ucla.sspace.temporal
Interface TemporalSemanticSpace

All Superinterfaces:
SemanticSpace
All Known Implementing Classes:
FileBasedTemporalSemanticSpace, FixedDurationTemporalRandomIndexing, OrderedTemporalRandomIndexing
public interface TemporalSemanticSpace
extends SemanticSpace

A common interface for interacting with semantic space models of meaning that include time information in their word representation.

Author:
David Jurgens
See Also:
SemanticSpace

          Returns the time for the latest semantics contained within this space.

                     throws IOException
Processes the contents of the provided reader as a document, using the current time as the timestamp.

                     long timestamp)
                     throws IOException
Processes the contents of the provided buffer as a document, using the provided timestamp as the date when the document was written.

getVectorAfter

Vector getVectorAfter(String word,
                      long startTime)
Returns the provided word's semantic vector based on all temporal occurrences occurring on or after the provided timestamp (optional operation).

Parameters:
word - a word in the semantic space
startTime - a UNIX timestamp that denotes the time after which all occurrences of the provided word should be counted.
Returns:
the semantic vector for the word after the provided time or null if the word was not in the space.

getVectorBefore

Vector getVectorBefore(String word,
                       long endTime)
Returns the provided word's semantic vector based on all temporal occurrences before the provided timestamp (optional operation).

Parameters:
word - a word in the semantic space
endTime - a UNIX timestamp that denotes the time before which all occurrences of the provided would should be counted.
Returns:
the semantic vector for the word after the provided time or null if the word was not in the space.

getVectorBetween

Vector getVectorBetween(String word,
                        long startTime,
                        long endTime)
Returns the provided word's semantic vector based on all temporal occurrences that happened on or after the start timestamp but before the ending timestamp (optional operation).

Parameters:
word - a word in the semantic space
startTime - a UNIX timestamp that denotes the time before which no occurrences of the word should be counted.
endTime - a UNIX timestamp that denotes the time after which no occurrences of the word should be counted.
Returns:
the semantic vector for the word after the provided time or null if the word was not in the space.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if startTime > endTime

getVector

Vector getVector(String word)
Returns the provided word's semantic vector based on all temporal occurrences.

Specified by:
getVector in interface SemanticSpace
Parameters:
word - a word that may be in the semantic space
Returns:
The Vector for the provided word or null if the word was not in the space.
